alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 4:02PM EDT until May 23 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WAKE COUNTY... At 401 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cary, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Research Triangle, Lake Wheeler and Lake Benson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
